messages.message: Hey y’all, I’m going to disable the Cypress tests for now. It seems like nearly all tests are failing and there’s a lot of noise in the logs to debug this effectively (see screenshot). Let me know if this is an issue.

So an interesting finding:
In Danny’s run (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/19054/overview/293fc364-2ae7-4853-93e4-c81d371a4708/replay?att=2&roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1&ts=1744844428115.8), I noticed a 502 `/lock` endpoint call, which was weird to me because that’s supposed to be a very lightweight endpoint.

What made it especially weird is that I don’t see it in the nginx logs. I see 200s just fine, but 50X is missing. This leads me to believe that the request is not even making it to our cluster
Each ci sandbox has its own server-nginx instance, so we need to go to the crafting UI to see the nginx logs for these 50X requests

My theory is that this is the same network issue that Matt has asked the crafting team about multiple times (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C03B865Q74K/p1744220347918199) 


@Paul H can you check the nginx logs for this error on a CI sandbox for one of these failed CI runs?
If this is just flakiness at the network layer in crafting… :shaking-angry-fist:
